newsitem.title: LEBANON: Beirut bank shares rise in heavy demand.
newsitem.headline: Beirut bank shares rise in heavy demand.

text.p: Beirut bank shares continued their breakneck upward charge on Tuesday amid continued heavy demand and active trading and brokers said they expected the mini-bull run on the Beirut Stock Exchange to continue.
Banque Audi rose to $20 from Monday's $19.625, Banque Libanaise pour le Commerce reached $15 from $14.75 and Bank of Beirut rose to $3.25 from $3.125.
"The market was very active with heavy demand mainly on bank shares," Carol Deeb, broker for Credit Commercial, told Reuters.
BLC and Banque Audi have jumped 33 percent since making their market debuts on December 30 and January 20, and BoB has jumped 49.8 percent since trading began last Friday.
The LIBX bank index rose 2.53 percent on the day to 129.10 and the two general indexes, the LISPI and BLOM Stock Index rose 0.91 percent and 0.43 percent respectively to 86.21 and 913.17.
Among the market's five other listed companies only Ciments Libanais rose to $1.28125 from $1.25 on April 10 when they were last traded. Some 15,000 shares changed hands.

Solidere A and B were unchanged at $10.25 and $10.75. Industrial pipemaker Eternit was unchanged at $2 and Ciments Blancs was unchanged at $5.5 unchanged on turnover of 150 shares. There was no trade in Uniceramic.

BoB faced continued massive demand of 5,400,256 shares compared with 3,153,158 shares on Monday and 6.5 million on Friday when they were listed. Supply was 132,886 shares, all of which were sold. Some 30,700 BoB shares were also sold in a block trade on the floor.
